intro: Calonema denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed calonema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Calonema denticulatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
